briefdescription.para: No animation.
Animating a gesture.
Animating a drag.
Values that represent animation states.
The animation ended callback.
The current animation state.
The animation steps.
The distance before aligned item.
The drag acceleration x10.
Is the container draggable in the horizontal direction.
Is the container draggable in the vertical direction.
The easing equation used for animation.
The gesture end.
The gesture start.
The current gesture step.
The total gesture steps.
The initial swipe offset.
The item locked in callback.
The item pressed callback.
The item selected callback.
Size of the item (including margin)
The list.
The maximum swipe items.
Number of drawables.
The swipe acceleration x10.
The x coordinate of a click.
The y coordinate of a click.
Enables horizontal scrolling to be passed to the children in the list (in case a child widget is able to handle drag events).

detaileddescription.para: By default, scrolling in either direction is disabled. This function can be used to explicitly (dis)allow scrolling in the horizontal direction.

parameterdescription.para: If true, horizontal scrolling is enabled. If false (default), scrolling is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enables the vertical scroll.

detaileddescription.para: Enables the vertical scroll to be passed to the children in the list (in case a child widget is able to handle drag events). By default, scrolling in either direction is disabled. This function can be used to explicitly (dis)allow scrolling in the vertical direction.

parameterdescription.para: If true, vertical scrolling is enabled. If false (default), scrolling is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Go to a specific item, possibly with animation.

detaileddescription.para: The given item index is scrolled into view. If animationSteps is omitted, the default number of animation steps is used. If animationSteps is 0 no animation will be used, otherwise the number of animation steps specified is used.

parameterdescription.para: (Optional) The steps to use for the animation. 0 means no animation. If omitted, default animation steps are used.

briefdescription.para: Gets animation steps as set in setAnimationSteps.
Gets the circular setting, previously set using setCircular().

simplesect.para: True if the list is circular (infinite), false if the list is not circular (finite).

briefdescription.para: Gets drag acceleration (times 10).

simplesect.para: The reason for multiplying the acceleration by 10 is to avoid introducing floating point arithmetic.

briefdescription.para: Gets drawable margin as set through the second parameter in most recent call to setDrawableSize().
Gets drawable size as set through the first parameter in most recent call to setDrawableSize().
Gets the orientation of the drawables, previously set using setHorizontal().

simplesect.para: True if it horizontal, false if it is vertical.

briefdescription.para: Gets maximum swipe items as set by setMaxSwipeItems.

simplesect.para: The maximum swipe items, 0 means "no limit".

briefdescription.para: Gets number of items in the DrawableList, as previously set using setNumberOfItems().
Gets swipe acceleration (times 10).

simplesect.para: The reason for multiplying the acceleration by 10 is to avoid introducing floating point arithmetic.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for DragEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The DragEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for GestureEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The GestureEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Called periodically by the framework if the Drawable instance has subscribed to timer ticks.
Removed all drawables and initializes the content of these items.
Query if an animation is ongoing.

detaileddescription.para: This can be good to know if getSelectedItem() is called, as the result might not be as expected if isAnimating() returns true, since the display is not showing the selected item in the right place yet.

simplesect.para: true if animating, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Inform the scroll list that the contents of an item has changed and force all drawables with the given item index to be updated via the callback provided.

detaileddescription.para: This is important as a circular list with very few items might display the same item more than once and all these items should be updated.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the changed item.

briefdescription.para: Callback, called when the set animation ended.
Sets animation steps (in ticks) when moving to a new selected item.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is 30.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the list is circular (infinite) or not.

detaileddescription.para: A circular list is a list where the first drawable re-appears after the last item in the list - and the last item in the list appears before the first item in the list.

parameterdescription.para: True if the list should be circular, false if the list should not be circular.

briefdescription.para: Sets drag acceleration times 10, so "10" means "1", "15" means "1.5".

detaileddescription.para: 10 makes the containers follow the finger, higher values makes the containers move faster. This can often be useful if the list is very long.

simplesect.para: The reason for multiplying the acceleration by 10 is to avoid introducing floating point arithmetic.

briefdescription.para: Sets drawables size.

detaileddescription.para: The drawable is is the size of each drawable in the list in the set direction of the list (this is enforced by the DrawableList class). The specified margin is added above and below each item for spacing. The entire size of an item is thus size + 2 * spacing.

For a horizontal list each element will be drawableSize high and have the same width as set using setWidth(). For a vertical list each element will be drawableSize wide and have the same height as set using setHeight().

parameterdescription.para: The margin around drawables (margin before and margin after).

briefdescription.para: Sets easing equation when changing the selected item, for example via swipe or AnimateTo.
Sets the height of this drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
Also sets the height of the children.

briefdescription.para: Sets a horizontal or vertical layout.

detaileddescription.para: If parameter horizontal is set true, all drawables are arranged side by side. If horizontal is set false, the drawables are arranged above and below each other (vertically).

parameterdescription.para: True to align drawables horizontal, false to align drawables vertically.

simplesect.para: Default value is false, i.e. vertical layout.

briefdescription.para: Set Callback which will be called when a item is pressed.
Sets Callback which will be called when the selected item is clicked.
Sets maximum swipe items.

detaileddescription.para: Often useful when there are e.g. five visible items on the screen and a swipe action should at most swipe the next/previous five items into view to achieve sort of a paging effect.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum items, 0 means "no limit" (which is also the default).

briefdescription.para: Sets number of items in the DrawableList.

detaileddescription.para: This forces all drawables to be updated to ensure that the content is correct. For example a date selector might switch number of days between 28, 29, 30, and 31 depending on the month. A circular list might show 27-28-29-30-31 and might need to update this to show 27-28-1-2-3.

simplesect.para: The DrawableList is refreshed to reflect the change.

briefdescription.para: Sets swipe acceleration (times 10).

detaileddescription.para: Default value, if not set, is 10, i.e. 1.0.

parameterdescription.para: The acceleration times 10, so "9" means "0.9" and "75" means "7.5".

simplesect.para: The reason for multiplying the acceleration by 10 is to avoid introducing floating point arithmetic.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of this drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
Also sets the width of the children.

briefdescription.para: Stops an animation if one is ongoing.

detaileddescription.para: Immediately moves to the item which is being animated to.

briefdescription.para: Animate to a new position/offset using the given number of steps.
Gets nearest offset aligned to a multiple of itemSize.
Gets normalized offset from a given offset from 0 down to -numItems*itemSize.
Gets display offset of first item.
Get the position for an item.

detaileddescription.para: The position should ensure that the item is in view as defined by the semantics of the actual scroll class. If the item is already in view, the current offset is returned and not the offset of the given item.

briefdescription.para: Keep offset inside limits.

detaileddescription.para: Return the new offset that is inside the limits of the scroll list, with the overShoot value added at both ends of the list.

simplesect.para: The new offset inside the limits.

briefdescription.para: Sets display offset of first item.
The ScrollBase class is an abstract class used for Widgets that needs to show (a lot of) elements in a DrawableList that can be scrolled.

detaileddescription.para: Due to memory limitations, this is implemented by re-using the Drawables in the DrawableList - once an element is moved off screen, it is filled with new content and moved to the other end and the of the scrolling list.
Lists can be horizontal or vertical and the can be circular (infinite scrolling).
